parameters: \N<Segi>...Let's have a little chat with Riia before we head out.

\N<Segi>What could it be... My body feels a bit hot. It's nothing
serious right now, but...

\N<Segi>What could it be... My body feels a bit hot. It's nothing
serious right now, but...

\N<Segi>That's right... Rozaro-san mentioned it. Today is the day of
Irime-san's match...

\N<Segi>Riia is not here... I wonder if he's already gone to the
training grounds.
\N<Segi>Wh-what's happening...? My body is... so hot...

\N<Segi>After all... my body feels hot. It's more noticeable than
just a few days ago...
\N<Segi>Rozaro-san, what brings you here at this hour?

\N<Rozaro>Segi-san, I apologize for the early disturbance. I was just
concerned about how the preparations for the training
session were going.

\N<Segi>Yes... It's not all smooth sailing, but in a way, I believe
things will work out as they're meant to.

\N<Segi>Ah... but please don't misunderstand me. It's not like I've
given up or become reckless.

\N<Segi>I am... simply doing the best I can with what I have right
now.
\N<Rozaro>I see... Maybe I was meddling unnecessarily then.

\N<Rozaro>You might already know this, but are you aware of the
request board set up inside the management office?

\N<Segi>Ah... yes. It's for job requests from the townspeople,
Lyuda's soldiers, and everyone living in this town...

\N<Rozaro>Exactly. The requests vary greatly, but some offer rewards
upon completion. I thought there might be something there
that could be of use to you.

\N<Rozaro>However, they're not something you must do for certain.
After all, your top priority isn't to fulfill others'
wishes. It should be Yuia and Riia's matters first and
foremost.

\N<Rozaro>Well, if you feel like it, it wouldn't hurt to take a look.
I might have been offering unnecessary advice though.

\N<Segi>No, not at all... I'm grateful for all the information
you've given me.

\N<Rozaro>Your friend... Irime-san, was it? Her match is scheduled for
tomorrow.

\N<Rozaro>You might want to attend if you feel like it. It could be
beneficial for you as well.

\N<Rozaro>Well then, Riia. Don't trouble your mother too much. You're
a man; you should be her support.
\N<Segi>The day of my battle has finally come...

\N<Segi>It's the day that will decide the fate of myself, Riia, and
Lord Yuia.
\N<Segi>I must go to the training grounds...
\N<Riia>Mom, I'm going out for a bit.

\N<Segi>Don't overdo it, okay? And make sure not to trouble Rozaro-
san, alright?
\N<Riia>Yeah, I understand. But I... want to become stronger.

\N<Riia>That's obvious. To protect you, Mom. To get stronger quickly
and fight alongside Dad.
\N<Riia>And not just you, Mom. The townspeople and Rame-chan too...
\N<Riia>Welcome back, Mom. You're quite late today.

\N<Segi>Ah, yes... I'm sorry. I had some important matters to attend
to.

\N<Riia>Is that so? I just got back from my training with the
master.

\N<Segi>I see... But don't overdo it, okay? If Riia gets hurt, Dad
will be sad too.

\N<Segi>You mustn't push yourself too hard, okay? If Riia gets hurt,
Papa will be sad too.

\N<Segi>Wh-What happened? You're injured. Did you get hurt during
training with Rozaro-san?

\N<Riia>It's nothing serious at all. No need to worry. And it's not
the instructor's fault, okay?
\N<Riia>It's because I'm weak. That's why I have to try even harder.

\N<Segi>Wh-what happened? You're injured. Did you get hurt during
training with Rozaro-san?

\N<Riia>It's nothing serious at all. No need to worry. Besides, it's
not the instructor's fault, right?
\N<Riia>It's because I'm weak. That's why I have to try even harder.

\N<Segi>Hey, Riia. How's your study going at the training grounds?
Can you tell Mama about it?
\N<Segi>What's wrong? Did something happen at the training grounds?

\N<Riia>No, it's not a big deal but... I just heard from Rame-chan
the other day...

\N<Riia>The master told me. If there's someone you want to be strong
for, you first have to become strong yourself.

\N<Riia>He had such a serious face. I don't really understand it,
but... what do you think, Mama?

\N<Riia>My mentor told me that if I want to help someone become
strong, I first have to become strong myself.

\N<Riia>He had a very serious look on his face. I don't really
understand it, but... what do you think, Mom?

\N<Segi>Hehe, don't make such a face. I'm just stepping out for a
bit. No need to worry, I'll be back soon.
\N<Segi>So... can you wait here for me?
\N<Riia>Mom! I was so worried! Where did you go?
\N<Riia>Just like Dad... if Mom disappeared too... I...

\N<Segi>I'm sorry for worrying you. There's no way Mom would leave
Riia and go somewhere, right?
\N<Segi>But you know, Riia. Mom... wants you to become strong too.
\N<Riia>I am strong! I've been training with my master.

\N<Segi>That's true. But the strength Mom is talking about is the
strength of the heart. Do you understand?
\N<Riia>I understand. It means I shouldn't cry easily, right?

\N<Segi>Yes, that's very good. That's why Mom has decided not to
cry. Can you hang in there with Mom until Dad comes back?
\N<Riia>Yeah. Until Dad comes back, I'll protect Mom.
\N<Segi>Hehe, then maybe Mom should rely on Riia?

\N<Riia>Leave it to me. I'll definitely become strong like you said,
Mom.

\N<Segi>Riia... Yes, that's right, let's work hard together. Mom
won't cry easily either...

\N<Segi>But still... a method to break through the hard shell... I
can't possibly think of anything...

\N<Segi>But... wait. Perhaps the soldiers of Ryuda might know
something.

\N<Segi>That's right... Rozaro-san also mentioned it. Ryuda
possesses advanced technology...

\N<Segi>Even if it's impossible for the other officers... maybe I
can extract some information from Zuuteruka.
About the purpose of the Training Soldiers Assembly
About the regulations of the Training Soldiers Assembly
・経典結社リュダについて

The religious society that conquered and destroyed Segi and
Yuia's hometown "Dawn's Ear," managing its followers through
unique scriptures and military force.

It can be called a night-watch state, and in recent years,
it has expanded its influence by subjugating surrounding
settlements one after another, backed by its high
technological and military power.
・練兵会開催の目的について

Each family is forced to provide one representative for
military service, and these representatives are made to
fight each other in combat tournaments for training
purposes.

Multiple duels among residents are held simultaneously, and
afterwards, a few outstanding soldiers are selected to be
recruited into the Lyuda ranks.

After the opponent is decided, the duel takes place after a
few days' grace period. During this time, the participating
warriors will devise strategies for the fight.

The duel is decided by death, incapacitation, or surrender.
However, even surrender does not guarantee safety
thereafter, let alone death or incapacitation.

If a man loses the fight, he is imprisoned and subjected to
harsh forced labor. Women are forced to live as the
concubines of the victor or Lyuda soldiers.

To win the training tournament and save her imprisoned
husband Yuia through the amnesty that comes as a reward.

To do this, she must gather information about her opponents
in the tournament, train herself in the ruins, and win the
competition.

As Yuia is imprisoned as a serious criminal, regular
tributes to Lyuda are essential for his life-prolonging
measures, and Segi must not let these lapse during the
tournament.

If the tributes cease, it is synonymous with losing the
guarantee of her imprisoned husband Yuia's life.

The side effect caused by Segi, who lacks combat experience,
taking the secret medicine "Mind.Lyuda" to enhance her
physical abilities.

Her lust rises and accumulates daily, and when it reaches
its limit (maximum value 100), an uncontrollable intense
sexual urge will overcome her body.

To prevent lust, it is necessary to lower the maximum value
through meetings with her husband Yuia or medication.
Engaging in sexual acts is also effective in relieving
sexual urges.

The ruins that gave their name to the underwater ruins city
where Segi and others live. It was once a tunnel dug using
criminals.

Rare resources were excavated inside the ruins, but at the
same time, it became a dangerous place filled with poison
gas and rampant monsters.

The poison gas continues to seep out even now. However,
since Lyuda's technology has produced an antidote to avoid
the gas, exploration inside has become possible.

The story is divided into chapters for each match, such as
the first match → second match.

Gather information for your next battle in town, explore the
ruins to obtain money and items.

In scenes where useful information or events necessary for
story progression occur, a [■EV occurrence■] mark will be
displayed.

\C[1]Blue indicates \C[0]conversation events or story progression
flags, \C[10]red\C[0] indicates when an event scene is
included.

The story may progress by advancing the date. If you feel
that nothing is progressing, rest in your home bed.

If a \C[3]■Rest Possible■\C[0] mark appears on your home
bed, you can recover your strength and move time forward to
the next day.

In this case, minor conversation events that could occur on
that day will not happen as time moves to the next day.

Conversely, if the \C[3]■Rest Possible■\C[0] mark is not
displayed on your home bed, it means there is something that
must be done within that day.

\C[3]The \C[0]■Rest Possible■ mark is merely a guideline that you
can proceed with the story. It does not mean "you have done
everything possible on the spot," so please be careful.

Also, each character generally appears in the same place. It
is recommended to visit places like Rozaro's tavern or
Irime's home regularly, especially if they are
collaborators.

Segi's ultimate goal is to win the training tournament
without defeat. If achieved, she can save her husband Yuia
and their family can return to their former life.

However, if Segi is defeated by men who aim to fight her in
the tournament, she will become theirs.

By being defiled by them, Segi will face an ending with each
of those men.

On the eve of the final match of the training tournament,
she must choose an ending with one of the men whether she
wants to or not...

■Rest in bed... Recover health and advance to the next day
■Mirror... Check your condition and view various character
sprites ■Bookshelf... Study various matters related to the
training sessions

The bookshelf also contains hints on how to progress the
story, so it is recommended that you read it first.
\N<Segi>...It might be useful. I'll take it with me.

Segi will jot down things that seem useful during the
training sessions. You can check how prepared you are for
battle by using it from the items menu.

Segi stared at her own reflection in the mirror. Though
faint, a shadow of sadness could be seen on her face.

Segi stared at her own reflection in the mirror. A clear
shadow of deep melancholy was evident on her face.
\N<Segi>...I don't want to think about anything right now.

Segi stared at her own reflection in the mirror. Her face
was flushed, and her breath contained a sweet tinge.

\N<Segi>...haah...haah...why is this happening...what's going to
happen to my body...?

Segi stared at her own reflection in the mirror. Her
expression was no different from usual.
\N<Segi>...There's no particular problem. I can still go on...

To raise funds, Segi can sell her personal belongings. These
items can be sold not at regular shops, but at the Ryuda
barracks.

Also, please note that once sold, no new personal items will
be added until the next battle.
\N<Segi>...I really don't want to do this...
\N<Segi>...I really don't want to do this...
\N<Segi>...I really don't want to do this, but...
\N<Segi>...I really don't want to do this, but...
\N<Segi>...I really don't want to do this...
